name: Battery
description:
Intentional Infliction of Harmful or Offensive bodily Contact.

First thing which is required in Battery is Intent To Act. Here Blink of eye is no as it is not a volational, Extending arm is volational and it is considered as Intent.

Mind must instruct to do something and it is Actual and Proximate cause (rarely an issue) of Harmful or Offensive Contact.

Mind must intend to cause either "Harmful or Offensive Contact" Or Apprehension of "Harmful or Offensive Contact".

In Battery, Objective standards are taken into consideration and not the subjective standards. That is what a reasonable person will feel harmful or offensive is considered in Battery, not the particular person will feel harmful or offensive touching.
elements: Volitional Act, the D acted volitionally
Intent, the D intended to cause a harmful or offensive contact
that a harmful or offensive contact actually occured
Causation, the D's volitional act caused the contact
conclusion: Therefore, the defendant may be liable for tortious battery.
